duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform and generate reports on all routine tests and testing activities.
Troubleshoot manufacturing & component problems to the lowest Line Replaceable Unit (LRU), and support during qualification tests.
Execute tests according to test procedures and schematics.
Demonstrate good working knowledge and experience with the use of computers, data recorders, digital millimeters, various measurement instruments, pneumatic/hydraulic gauges.
Reading and understanding of schematics and wire lists.
Clearly document and report any anomaly or failure during test execution.
Responsible for learning curve and optimization of test execution and troubleshooting.
Support mechanical installations and repairs on rail vehicles as directed by Supervisor.
Support, installation and terminate of electrical panels, equipment, components, and have a good understanding of how they operate in order to troubleshoot any electrical issues.
Must be able to work different shifts and overtime as needed.
Must be able to lift 50 lbs.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or Equivalent Required. Electrical Engineering Degree Desirable.
